ReferenceError.what: Variable or function is used before it's declared or doesn't exist
ReferenceError.why: The code references a name that hasn't been defined in the current scope
fix: Check if the variable/function name is spelled correctly
Ensure the variable is declared before use (use const/let/var)
Verify imports if it's from another module
Check variable scope (global vs local)
For functions, check if they're hoisted (function declarations vs expressions)
Verify the module/file is imported correctly

TypeError.what: Operation performed on wrong data type or null/undefined value
TypeError.why: Trying to access properties or methods on undefined/null or incompatible types
fix: Add null/undefined checks before accessing properties
Use optional chaining (?.) to safely access nested properties
Verify the variable has the expected type before operations
Check if objects/arrays are initialized before use
Use type guards or typeof checks
Consider using default values: obj?.prop ?? defaultValue

SyntaxError.why: Code doesn't follow JavaScript grammar rules
fix: Check for missing brackets, parentheses, or quotes
Verify semicolons are used correctly
Look for typos in keywords (const vs var, function vs fn)
Check for unclosed strings or template literals
Verify arrow function syntax: () => {}
Check for missing commas in objects/arrays
Ensure template literals use backticks, not quotes

RangeError.why: Numeric value exceeds limits or array index is invalid
fix: Check array indices are within bounds (0 to length-1)
Verify numeric values are within expected ranges
Use array.length checks before accessing elements
Check for negative array indices
Verify stack size isn't exceeded (recursion depth)

EvalError.why: Invalid code passed to eval() or eval() not allowed in strict mode
fix: Avoid using eval() - use safer alternatives
If necessary, validate input before passing to eval()
Consider using Function constructor or JSON.parse() instead
Use template literals or string interpolation instead
Consider using a proper parser for dynamic code

URIError.why: Malformed URI passed to encodeURI/decodeURI functions
fix: Validate URI strings before encoding/decoding
Use try-catch around URI operations
Check URI format matches expected pattern
Use URL constructor for validation: new URL(uri)
Escape special characters properly

InternalError.why: Stack overflow, too much recursion, or engine bug
fix: Check for infinite recursion or loops
Reduce stack depth by refactoring recursive functions
Use iterative solutions instead of recursive ones
Increase stack size if possible (Node.js: --stack-size)
Break large operations into smaller chunks

PromiseRejection.why: Promise was rejected but no .catch() or try/catch handled it
fix: Add .catch() handler to promises
Use async/await with try/catch blocks
Handle errors in Promise.all() with .catch()
Add global unhandledRejection handler
Ensure all async functions have error handling

AsyncError.what: Error in async function or promise chain
AsyncError.why: Exception thrown in async code without proper error handling
fix: Wrap async code in try/catch blocks
Add .catch() to promise chains
Check if function is marked as async
Verify await is used correctly
Handle errors in Promise.allSettled() or Promise.all()

ImportError.what: Failed to import module or dependency
ImportError.why: Module not found, circular dependency, or export mismatch
fix: Verify the import path is correct
Check if package is installed: npm list <package>
Look for circular dependencies
Verify exports match imports (default vs named)
Check file extensions (.js, .mjs, .ts)
Ensure module type is correct (ESM vs CommonJS)

ExportError.why: Invalid export syntax or conflicting exports
fix: Check export syntax (export default vs export const)
Verify only one default export per module
Ensure exports match import expectations
Check for conflicting named exports
Verify module type supports the export syntax

CircularDependency.why: Module A imports B, and B imports A (directly or indirectly)
fix: Refactor to break the circular dependency
Move shared code to a third module
Use dynamic imports: import()
Extract common functionality to a separate file
Restructure module dependencies

MemoryError.what: Out of memory or memory leak
MemoryError.why: Too much memory allocated or memory not released
fix: Check for memory leaks (event listeners, timers)
Clear large arrays/objects when done
Use weak references (WeakMap, WeakSet) where appropriate
Increase Node.js memory: node --max-old-space-size=4096
Profile memory usage with Chrome DevTools

TimeoutError.why: Async operation took too long to complete
fix: Increase timeout value if operation is legitimate
Check for hanging promises or async operations
Add timeout handling: Promise.race() with timeout
Verify network requests aren't stuck
Check for infinite loops in async code

NetworkError.why: Connection refused, timeout, or network unavailable
fix: Check network connectivity
Verify URL/endpoint is correct
Check CORS settings if browser
Verify firewall/proxy settings
Test with curl or Postman
Check SSL/certificate issues

ValidationError.why: Input doesn't match expected format or constraints
fix: Check validation rules and error message
Verify input format matches requirements
Add proper validation before processing
Check required fields are present
Validate data types and ranges

PermissionError.why: Insufficient permissions for file system or resource access
fix: Check file/folder permissions: chmod
Verify user has required permissions
Run with appropriate privileges if needed
Check file ownership: chown
Verify path exists and is accessible

FileNotFound.why: Path is incorrect, file doesn't exist, or wrong working directory
fix: Verify the file path is correct
Check if file exists: fs.existsSync() or ls
Verify working directory is correct
Check for typos in filename
Use absolute paths if relative paths fail
Check file permissions
